SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am01
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am01.client.tui.rendering.draw

Class DrawArea

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am01.client.tui.rendering.draw.DrawArea
public class DrawArea extends Object
A drawing area on a DrawBuffer.

This class servers two purposes:

  • it restricts the drawing area to a specific rectangle, to prevent components from drawing outside their bounds
  • it simplifies the drawing process by providing utility methods to set the graphical rendition

A single DrawArea is actually three rectangles:

  • the DrawBuffer area, which is the entire area of the DrawBuffer
  • the crop area, which is the area of the DrawBuffer that is actually visible (this area is always fully contained in the DrawBuffer area)
  • the drawing area, which is the area of the DrawBuffer that the DrawArea is allowed to draw on. This area is not necessary fully inscribed in the DrawBuffer area.
Only the drawing area is exposed to the user. All methods that deal with Dimensions or Position do so in the drawing area space.

This three-area arrangement allows for drawing a component partially or fully outside the DrawBuffer area (useful for Scroll).

  • Constructor Details

    • DrawArea

      public DrawArea(DrawBuffer drawBuffer)
      Creates a new DrawArea that covers the entire DrawBuffer.
      Parameters:
      drawBuffer - the DrawBuffer to draw on

    • DrawArea

      protected DrawArea(DrawBuffer drawBuffer, DrawArea.Rectangle cropArea, DrawArea.Rectangle area)
      Creates a new DrawArea that is cropped to the given area.
      Parameters:
      drawBuffer - the DrawBuffer to draw on
      cropArea - the area to crop the DrawArea to
      area - the area to draw on

  • Method Details

    • getSubarea

      public DrawArea getSubarea(Position offset, Dimensions dimensions)
      Gets a subarea of this DrawArea.

      The subarea is specified in the current drawing area space. The subarea must be fully contained in the current drawing area.

      Parameters:
      offset - the offset of the subarea, relative to the top-left corner of the drawing area
      dimensions - the dimensions of the subarea
      Returns:
      a new DrawArea that covers the subarea
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the subarea is not fully contained in the current drawing area

    • getRelativeArea

      public DrawArea getRelativeArea(int xOffset, int yOffset, Dimensions dimensions)
      Gets a new DrawArea with a position relative to this one.

      The new area is specified in the current drawing area space. The new area does not need to be fully contained in the current drawing area, it could even be outside the DrawBuffer area.

      Parameters:
      xOffset - the x offset of the new area. Can be positive or negative
      yOffset - the y offset of the new area. Can be positive or negative
      dimensions - the dimensions of the new area
      Returns:
      a new DrawArea

    • dimensions

      public Dimensions dimensions()
      Returns:
      the dimensions of the drawing area

    • draw

      public void draw(Position position, char c)
      Draws a character at the given position.

      The position is specified in the current drawing area space. The character is drawn with the current graphical rendition.

      Parameters:
      position - the position to draw at
      c - the character to draw

    • draw

      public void draw(int x, int y, char c)
      Draws a character at the given position.

      The position is specified in the current drawing area space. The character is drawn with the current graphical rendition.

      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the position to draw at
      y - the y coordinate of the position to draw at
      c - the character to draw
